sentence.Network_en: It is true that colonialism did not bequeath much to Africa.
sentence.Network_cn: 殖民主义给非洲确实没有留下多少东西。

sentence.Network_en: a country struggling to free itself from the shackles of colonialism
sentence.Network_cn: 为摆脱殖民主义的枷锁而斗争的国家

sentence.Network_en: Deviate from socialism and China will inevitably retrogress to semi - feudalism and semi - colonialism .
sentence.Network_cn: 中国离开社会主义就必然退回到半封建 半殖民地.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 殖民主义(colonialism)，资本主义国家采取军事、政治和经济手段，占领、奴役和剥削弱小国家、民族和落后地区，将其变为殖民地、 …

以太空殖民地( Space Colony )的生活改善和保护地球环境为目的。事实上为拿工资而参加的成员也不少。

entry.def: Colonialism is the practice by which a powerful country directly controls less powerful countries and uses their resources to increase its own power and wealth.

example.ex: ...the bitter oppression of slavery and colonialism...
example.tran: 奴隶制度和殖民主义的残酷压迫

example.ex: It is interesting to reflect why European colonialism ended.
example.tran: 仔细想想欧洲殖民主义终结的原因会很有意思。

means.word_mean: 1. exploitation by a stronger country of weaker one; the use of the weaker country's resources to strengthen and enrich the stronger country

auth_sentence.content: The history of colonialism in Zimbabwe is not new.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: The history of colonialism in Zimbabwe is not new.

auth_sentence.content: We come from the history of colonialism.
auth_sentence.res_content: We come from the history of colonialism.

sentences.en: The town grew under the influence of colonialism.
sentences.cn: 这个镇是在殖民主义的影响下发展起来的。

sentences.en: Those African leaders have now fallen victims of neocolonialism and sold their fellow Africans down the river.
sentences.cn: 那些非洲领袖现已沦为新殖民主义的牺牲品而将同胞出卖了。
